{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about speech problems in cleft palate patients. Cleft lip and palate is known to be associated with a number of other skeletal anomalies, including possible malformations of the cervical spine and their relationship to velopharyngeal incompetence. Velopharyngeal incompetence refers to the inability of the soft palate to stop air from entering the nasopharynx. This can lead to speech problems such as hypernasality, which is a characteristic feature of cleft palate speech.,", "answer_choice": "B"}
